title: Should we support CULT DAO in launching a CULT/ETH RegenFarm?
body:
They are interested in setting up a RegenFarm to rewards their liquidity providers for CULT/ETH on Mainnet.

Lots of context is given in the forum post [here](https://forum.giveth.io/t/cult-dao-regen-farm/518).
author: 0xC46c67Bb7E84490D7EbdD0b8ecDaca68Cf3823F4

title: Setup GIV/DAI Farm on Uniswap v2?
body:
Following the Closure of the Univ3 Farm we discussed implementing a new liquidity solution on Uniswap. The process has begun to create the Angel Vault using $oneGIV -https://forum.giveth.io/t/giveth-ichi-angel-vault-proposal/443/26
However, it's become clear that this process will take time and has some complexities. 

I would propose for the short term to fire up a GIV/DAI GIVfarm using Uniswap v2 to cover this gap and provide another farming opportunity for mainnet liqudity provision. 

This idea was discussed and received some favour in this thread -
https://forum.giveth.io/t/mainnet-liquidity-solution-ideas-now-that-univ3-is-being-turned-off/440/10

These are the specs I propose for the farm:
- Allocate 750k GIV in Rewards
- Program ends in June 2022 -  same as the other pools (less than 2 months)
- Follows the same distribution % wave as the GIV/ETH BAL Pool
author: 0x826976d7C600d45FB8287CA1d7c76FC8eb732030

title: Should we end the mainnet GIVsteams of the univ3 "middle fingers"?
body:
This is a proposal to terminate the disproportionate mainnet GIVstreams allocated to 3 address who took advantage of information asymmetry & got huge earnings from providing concentrated liquidity in Univ3 rewards program.

As you may be aware, the Univ3 rewards program was poorly designed based on incorrect assumptions. We later became aware that a handful of addresses were privvy to information asymmetry and were taking advantage of the program providing concentrated liquidity and earning rewards disproportionate to the value-added to the community. No significant mainnet rewards were earned by other means & in many cases, these addresses have been dumping the GIV earned.

On March 21, 2022 after unanimous community approval, we [terminated the univ3 rewards program](https://forum.giveth.io/t/the-univ3-farm-is-being-taken-advantage-of-we-need-to-fix-it/413) to protect the GIVeconomy.

There is still a balance of more than 2.6 million GIV on mainnet in the Token Distro allocated to the address that were taking advantage of our poorly designed rewards program, which is set to flow via the GIVstream until December 2026.

In there interest of the long-term sustainability of GIV and the GIVeconomy, this is a proposal to terminate the mainnet GIVstreams of these 3 addresses.
0x213439b642dbb9d5ee7bafdafb1f33f9ab8b7e35
0xb66edbf805783e67a9b1039f7524e5009631c847
0x261f436676cfa456a8f086a850160e97550aea9c

Analysis and significant context is given in [this forum post](https://forum.giveth.io/t/the-univ3-farm-is-being-taken-advantage-of-we-need-to-fix-it/413)
author: 0x839395e20bbB182fa440d08F850E6c7A8f6F0780

title: Should we shut off the univ3 rewards?
body:
The univ3 rewards program is being taken advantage of, with huge rewards going to one party who is dumping the GIV and hurting the economy. 

There is significant context given in the forum post: https://forum.giveth.io/t/the-univ3-farm-is-being-taken-advantage-of-we-need-to-fix-it/413/7

If this vote passes, we will shut off the rewards program on March 21.
Next steps would be:
1. Communicate to our users that weâ€™re shutting it off & ask them to claim rewards
2. On March 21, take a snapshot of current stakers & unclaimed rewards earned
3. Shut off rewards program
4. Distribute any unclaimed rewards to users to be claimed
author: 0xC46c67Bb7E84490D7EbdD0b8ecDaca68Cf3823F4
